Genre: English mystery and miracle plays.

Joseph How dame how vn-do ?oure dore vn-do Are ?e at hom why speke ?e notht Susanna Who is ther why cry ?e so telle us ?our herand wyl ?e ought. Joseph Vn-do ?our dore I sey ?ow to Ffor to com in is all my thought. Maria it is my spowse Ã¾at spekyth us to On-do Ã¾e dore his wyl were wrought. well-come hom myn husbond dere how haue ?e ferd in fer countre. Joseph To gete oure levynge with-owtyn dwere I haue sore laboryd ffor Ã¾e and me. Maria husbond ryght gracyously now come be ?e it solacyth me sore sothly to se ?ow in syth. Joseph Me merveylyth wyff surely ?our face I can not se but as Ã¾e sonne with his bemys quan he is most bryth. Maria Husbond it is as it plesyth oure lord Ã¾at grace of hym grew Who Ã¾at evyr be-holdyth me veryly they xal be grettly steryed to vertu ffor Ã¾is ?yfte and many moo good lord gramercy. Joseph How hast Ã¾ou ferde jentyl mayde whyl I haue be out of londe. Maria Sekyr sere beth nowth dysmayde Ryth aftyr Ã¾e wyl of goddys sonde. joseph That semyth evyl I am afrayd Ã¾i wombe to hy?e doth stonde I drede me sore I am be-trayd Sum other man Ã¾e had in honde Hens sythe Ã¾at I went Thy Wombe is gret it gynnyth to ryse than hast Ã¾ou be-gownne a synfull gyse telle me now in what wyse thy self Ã¾ou Ast Ã¾us schent. Ow dame what Ã¾inge menyth this with childe Ã¾ou gynnyst ryth gret to gon Sey me mary Ã¾is childys fadyr ho is I pray Ã¾e telle me and Ã¾at anon Maria The fadyr of hevyn and ?e it is other fadyr hath he non I dede nevyr forfete with man i-wys Wher-fore I pray ?ow amende ?our mon this childe is goddys and ?our. Joseph Goddys childe Ã¾ou lyist in fay God dede nevyr jape so with may And I cam nevyr ther I dare wel say ?itt so nyh Ã¾i boure But ?it I sey mary whoos childe is this. Maria Goddys and ?oure I sey i-wys. Joseph ?a ?a all Olde men to me take tent and weddyth no wyff in no kynnys wyse Ã¾at is a ?onge wench be myn a-sent ffor doute and drede and swych servyse Alas Alas my name is shent all men may me now dyspyse and seyn olde cokwold Ã¾i bow is bent newly now after Ã¾e frensche gyse Alas and welaway Alas dame why dedyst Ã¾ou so Ffor Ã¾is synne Ã¾at Ã¾ou hast do I the for-sake and from Ã¾e go Ffor onys evyr and Ay. Maria Alas gode spowse why sey ?e thus Alas dere hosbund a-mende ?our mod It is no man but swete jhesus he wyll be clad in flesch and blood and of ?our wyff be born. Sephor Ffor sothe Ã¾e Aungel Ã¾us seyd he Ã¾at goddys sone in trynite Ffor mannys sake a man wolde be to save Ã¾at is for-lorn. Joseph An Aungel allas alas fy for schame ?e syn now in Ã¾at ?e to say to puttyn an Aungel in so gret blame Alas alas let be do way It was sum boy be-gan Ã¾is game Ã¾at clothyd was clene and gay and ?e ?eve hym now an Aungel name Alas alas and wel away Ã¾at evyr this game be-tydde A dame what thought haddyst Ã¾ou Here may all men Ã¾is proverbe trow Ã¾at many a man doth bete Ã¾e bow Another man hath Ã¾e brydde. Maria A gracyous god in hefne trone comforte my spowse in Ã¾is hard cas mercyful god A-mend his mone as I dede nevyr so gret trespas. Joseph Lo Lo Serys What told I ?ow Ã¾at it was not for my prow A wyff to take me to An Ã¾at is wel sene now Ffor mary I make god A-vow is grett with childe lo Alas why is it so to Ã¾e busshop I wole it telle Ã¾at he Ã¾e law may here do With stonys here to qwelle. Nay nay ?et god ffor-bede Ã¾at I xuld do Ã¾at vegeabyl dede but if I wyst wel qwy I knew never with here so god me spede tokyn of thynge in word nor dede Ã¾at towchyd velany nevyr Ã¾e les what for thy Ã¾ow she be meke and mylde With-owth mannys company she myght not be with childe. But I ensure myn was it nevyr thow Ã¾at she hath not don here devyr rather than I xuld pleynyn opynly Serteynly ?itt had I levyr Ffor sake Ã¾e countre ffor evyr and nevyr come in here company Ffor and men knew Ã¾is velany In repreff Ã¾ei wolde me holde and ?ett many bettyr than I ?a hath ben made cokolde Now alas whedyr xal I gone I wot nevyr whedyr nor to what place ffor oftyn tyme sorwe comyth sone and longe it is or it pace no comforte may I haue here I-wys wyff Ã¾ou dedyst me wronge Alas I taryed from Ã¾e to longe All men haue pety on me amonge Ffor to my sorwe is no chere. Maria God Ã¾at in my body Art sesyd Ã¾ou knowist myn husbond is dysplesyd to se me in Ã¾is plight Ffor vnknowlage he is desesyd and Ã¾erfore help Ã¾at he were esyd Ã¾at he myght knowe Ã¾e ful perfyght Ffor I haue levyr abyde respyt to kepe Ã¾i sone in priuite grauntyd by Ã¾e holy spyryt Ã¾an Ã¾at it xulde be opynd by me. Deus Descende I sey myn Aungelle on to joseph for to telle such as my wyl is byd hym with mary A-byde and dwelle Ffor it is my sone fful snelle Ã¾at she is with i-wys. Angelus Almyghty god of blys I am redy ffor to wende wedyr as Ã¾i wyl is to go bothe fer and hynde Joseph Joseph Ã¾ou wepyst shyrle ffro Ã¾i wyff why comyst Ã¾ou owte. Joseph Good sere lete me wepe my ffylle Go forthe Ã¾i wey and lett me nowght. Angelus In Ã¾i wepynge Ã¾ou dost ryght ylle A-?ens god Ã¾ou hast mys-wrought Go chere Ã¾i wyff with herty wylle and chawnge Ã¾i chere Amende Ã¾i thought Sche is a ful clene may I telle Ã¾e god wyl of here be born And sche clene mayd as she was be-forn to saue mankynd Ã¾at is for-lorn Go chere hyre Ã¾erfore I say. Joseph A lord god benedicite of Ã¾i gret comforte I thank the Ã¾at Ã¾ou sent me Ã¾is space I myght wel A wyst parde So good a creature as she wold nevyr A done trespace For sche is ful of grace I know wel I haue myswrought I walk to my pore place and Aske ffor-gyfnes I haue mys-thought. Now is Ã¾e tyme sen At eye Ã¾at Ã¾e childe is now to veryfye which xal saue mankende As it was spoke be prophesye I thank Ã¾e god Ã¾at syttys on hye with hert wyl and mende Ã¾at evyr Ã¾ou woldyst me bynde to wedde mary to my wyff Ã¾i blysful sone so nere to fynde In his presens to lede my lyff. Alas ffor joy I qwedyr and qwake Alas what hap now was this A mercy mercy my jentyl make mercy I haue seyd al Amys All Ã¾at I haue seyd here I for-sake ?our swete fete now lete me kys. Mary Nay lett be my fete not Ã¾o ?e take my mowthe ?e may kys i-wys and welcom on to me. Joseph Gramercy myn owyn swete wyff gramercy myn hert my love my lyff xal I nevyr more make suche stryff be-twyx me and Ã¾e. A mary mary wel Ã¾ou be and blyssyd be Ã¾e frewte in the goddys sone of myght now good wyff fful of pyte as be not evyl payd with me Ã¾ow Ã¾at Ã¾ou haue good ryght As for my wronge in syght to wyte Ã¾e with ony synne had Ã¾ou not be A vertuous wythe god wold not A be Ã¾e with-inne. I knowlage I haue don A-mys I was never wurthy i-wys ffor to be Ã¾in husbonde I xal amende Aftere thys ryght as Ã¾in owyn wyl is to serve Ã¾e at foot and honde and Ã¾i chylde bothe to vndyr-stonde to wurchep hym with good Affeccion and Ã¾erfore telle me and nothynge whonde the holy matere of ?our concepcion. Maria At ?owre owyn wyll as ?e bydde me ther cam An Aunge hyght Gabryell and gret me ffayr and seyd Aue And ferther more to me gan tell God xulde be borne of my bode Ã¾e ffendys pouste ffor to ffelle Ã¾orwe Ã¾e holy gost as I wel se Ã¾us god in me wyl byde and dwelle. Joseph Now I thank god with spech and spelle Ã¾at Euyr mary I was weddyd to the. Mary it was Ã¾e werk of god as I ?ow telle now blyssyd be Ã¾at lord so purveyd for me.
